items.name: Object_Picture
items.content:
# ===================================================================
#
#   Script: Object_Picture
#
#   $$COPYRIGHT$$
#
# ===================================================================
class Object_Picture extends gs.Object_Visual
    @objectCodecBlackList = ["parent"]
   
    ###*
    * A game object used for pictures in a scene.
    *
    * @module gs
    * @class Object_Picture
    * @extends gs.Object_Visual
    * @memberof gs
    * @constructor
    ###
    constructor: (parent, data, type) ->
        super(data)
        
        ###*
        * The object's source rectangle. It controls which part of the object's image is used
        * for visual presentation.
        * @property srcRect
        * @type gs.Rect
        ###
        @srcRect = new Rect()
        
        ###*
        * The object's mask to execute masking-effects on it.
        * @property mask
        * @type gs.Mask
        ###
        @mask = new gs.Mask()
        
        ###*
        * The domain the object belongs to.
        * @property domain
        * @type string
        ###
        @domain = "com.degica.vnm.default"
        
        ###*
        
        * Indicates if the object's visual presentation should be mirrored horizontally.
        * @property mirror
        * @type boolean
        ###
        @mirror = false
        
        ###*
        * The object's image used for visual presentation.
        * @property image
        * @type string
        ###
        @image = ""
        
        ###*
        * The rotation-angle of the picture in degrees. The rotation center depends on the
        * anchor-point.
        * @property angle
        * @type number
        ###
        @angle = 0
        
        
        ###*
        * The color tone of the object used for the visual presentation.
        * @property tone
        * @type gs.Tone
        ###
        @tone = new Tone(0, 0, 0, 0)
        
        ###*
        * The color of the object used for the visual presentation.
        * @property color
        * @type gs.Color
        ###
        @color = new Color(255, 255, 255, 0)
        
        ###*
        * Contains different kinds of effects which can be activated for the object.
        * @property effects
        * @type Object
        ###
        @effects = new gs.EffectCollection()
        
        ###*
        * The object's animator-component to execute different kind of animations like move, rotate, etc. on it.
        * @property animator
        * @type vn.Component_Animator
        ###
        @animator = new gs.Component_Animator()
        
        ###*
        * The object's visual-component to display the game object on screen.
        * @property visual
        * @type gs.Component_Sprite|gs.Component_TilingSprite|gs.Component_Frame|gs.Component_ThreePartImage|gs.Component_Quad
        ###
        switch type
            when 0 then @visual = new gs.Component_Sprite()
            when 1 then @visual = new gs.Component_TilingSprite()
            when 2 then @visual = new gs.Component_Frame()
            when 3 then @visual = new gs.Component_ThreePartImage()
            when 4 then @visual = new gs.Component_Quad()
            else @visual = new gs.Component_Sprite()
        
        
        @frameThickness = 16
        @frameCornerSize = 16
        @firstPartSize = 7
        @middlePartSize = 1
        @lastPartSize = 7
        
        @addComponent(@visual)
        @addComponent(@animator)
        @componentsFromDataBundle(data)
     
    ###*
    * Restores the game object from a data-bundle.
    *
    * @method restore
    * @param {Object} data - The data-bundle.
    ###    
    restore: (data) ->
        super(data)
        
        @srcRect = gs.Rect.fromObject(data.srcRect)
        @mask = gs.Mask.fromObject(data.mask)
        @motionBlur = gs.MotionBlur.fromObject(data.motionBlur)
        
    ###*
    * Serializes the object into a data-bundle.
    *
    * @method toDataBundle
    * @return {Object} The data-bundle.
    ###    
    toDataBundle: ->
        components = @componentsToDataBundle(gs.Component_Animation)
                
        result = {
            dstRect: @dstRect,
            srcRect: @srcRect,
            opacity: @opacity,
            origin: @origin,
            zIndex: @zIndex,
            mask: @mask.toDataBundle(),
            motionBlur: @motionBlur,
            zoom: @zoom,
            angle: @angle,
            anchor: @anchor,
            offset: @offset,
            mirror: @mirror,
            image: @image,
            components: components
        }
    
        return result
        
gs.Object_Picture = Object_Picture
